026package com.ibm.streams.operator.control.patterns;
027
028import java.text.MessageFormat;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.HashSet;
031import java.util.Set;
032import java.util.logging.Logger;
033
034import javax.management.MBeanServerConnection;
035import javax.management.NotificationFilter;
036import javax.management.NotificationFilterSupport;
037import javax.management.NotificationListener;
038import javax.management.ObjectName;
039
040import com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator;
041import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
042import com.ibm.streams.operator.control.Controllable;
043
044/**
045 * Abstract operator for listening to notifications
046 * from the Job Control Plane and then submitting tuples
047 * derived from the notification to an output port.
048 * 
049 */
050public abstract class AbstractNotificationSource extends AbstractOperator implements Controllable {
051        
052        private static Logger trace = Logger.getLogger(AbstractNotificationSource.class.getName());
053
054        /**
055         * 
056         */
057        private String[] objectNames;
058        private String[] filters;
059
060        /**
061         * Set the object names to listen to.
062         */
063        public void setObjectNames(String[] objectNames) {
064                this.objectNames = objectNames;
065        }
066
067        public String[] getObjectNames() {
068                return objectNames;
069        }
070
071        /**
072         * Set the filters. Filters are simple filters
073         * on the notification type.
074         * @param filters
075         */
076        public void setFilters(String[] filters) {
077                this.filters = filters;
078        }
079
080        public String[] getFilters() {
081                return filters;
082        }
083        
084        private NotificationFilter notificationFilter;
085        private NotificationListener notificationListener;
086
087        @Override
088        public void initialize(OperatorContext context)
089                        throws Exception {
090                super.initialize(context);
091                this.setLoggerAspects(trace.getName(), "jmx", "notification");
092                createAvoidCompletionThread();
093                
094                this.notificationFilter = getFilter();
095                this.notificationListener = getNotificationListener();
096                
097                // Attach as soon as possible, to avoid any delays during allPortsReady.
098                getControlPlaneContext().connect();
099        }
100        
101        protected NotificationListener getNotificationListener() {
102            // TODO getOutput(int) includes only regular output ports.
103            // It is possible that this operator has only exception ports,
104            // in which case this needs to get an exception ports.  I am not
105            // sure how this works.
106            return new NotificationTupleSubmitter(getOperatorContext(), getOutput(0));
107        }
108        
109    protected NotificationFilter getFilter() {
110        if (getFilters() == null)
111            return null;
112        final NotificationFilterSupport filter = new NotificationFilterSupport();
113        for (String filteredType : getFilters())
114            filter.enableType(filteredType);
115        return filter;
116    }
117        
118    
119    /**
120     * Connect this to the Job Control Plane as
121     * a {@link Controllable}. The {@link Controllable} is
122     * only connected at {@link com.ibm.streams.operator.Operator#allPortsReady()}
123     * to ensure no tuples are submitted before the output port is ready.
124     */
125        @Override
126        public void allPortsReady() throws Exception {
127            getControlPlaneContext().connect(this);
128        }
129        
130        /**
131         * Is this {@link Controllable} applicable
132         * for this invocation.
133         * Return true as the assumption is that
134         * this {@code Controllable} is always application
135         * for its own operator. Sub-classes may override this
136         * if they there is no requirement to connect to the
137         * control plane for some invocations.
138         * @return true
139         * @see Controllable#isApplicable(OperatorContext)
140         */
141        @Override
142        public boolean isApplicable(OperatorContext context) {
143                return true;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Add the notification listener to each MBean listed in the
148         * getObjectNames() array using the filter.
149         * The standard handler will submit a tuple to port 0 for each notification 
150         */
151        @Override
152        public void setup(MBeanServerConnection mbs, OperatorContext context)
153                        throws Exception {
154                
155                final Set<String> objectNames = new HashSet<String>(Arrays.asList(getObjectNames()));
156                trace.info("Adding listeners to:" + objectNames);
157
158        for (String ons : objectNames) {
159            ObjectName on = ObjectName.getInstance(ons);
160
161            trace.info(MessageFormat.format(
162                    "Notification listener request: {0}", on.getCanonicalName()));
163
164            mbs.addNotificationListener(on, notificationListener,
165                    notificationFilter, null);
166
167            trace.info(MessageFormat.format(
168                    "Added notification listener to: {0}",
169                    on.getCanonicalName()));
170        }
171
172                trace.info("Done adding listeners.");
173        }
174}
